review_title: Definitely fun, with a few shortcomings.
one_reviews_text:
First and foremost, let me clarify that this is definitely an enjoyable game, especially considering it's free. It still feels like a bit of a work in progress, though, and I hope this review is useful to the developers if they choose to update it. It's missing a few standard rules (which I'll link to), has a few bugs, and has a bit of room for development when it comes to customization. 

Rules: 
~"Any other physical contact with a piece, except for clearly accidental contact, shall be considered to be intent [and must be moved if a legal move is possible]." (FIDE 4.2.2). Once a piece is touched, it should be the only possible move. Although I understand if implementing this could be frustrating in VR. 
~"Where a pawn reaches the eighth rank and is replaced by a new queen, rook, bishop or knight of the same colour." (FIDE 3.7.5.3). Currently, the game defaults promotions to Queen, which may not be the most effective piece in certain circumstances. 
~"A player may claim a draw if the last 50 moves have been completed by each player without the movement of any pawn and without any capture." (FIDE 5.3.2). 
~"The game is drawn if the last 75 moves have been completed by each player without the movement of any pawn and without any capture." (FIDE 9.6.2)
~"A player may claim a draw if the same position occurs three times. 2. A game is drawn if the same position occurs five times." (5.3.1.1-2)
(ref. https://www.fide.com/fide/handbook.html?id=208&view=article )
If you were to be playing with another person, both knowing the rules, this wouldn't be an issue, but it would be nice to have these be configurable for when playing with players / AI. 

Other notes: The AI is fairly easy to beat. It might be worthwhile taking a look into some other chess engines to allow for a bit more of a challenge. A level 7-8 bot shouldn't be losing to anything but forced mates. 

Thanks for hearing me out, and have a fantastic day!

review_title: Beautiful Environments and easy to play
one_reviews_text: Its great this this game is free, as it is very good. You can't hide the menu and the chess board should indicate in which direction the chess piece can move for beginners, but its very good and has good difficulty settings
Really impressive app, especially for free. This is an excellent foundation for a multiplayer game going forward.
Computer has no idea how to play Chess.  I also lost a game even though I had taken all of the computer's pieces, draw by stalemate.  That doesn't even make any sense.
review_feedback: Hi Doctor Hino! Whoa, you're right...that doesn't make any sense at all. So that would be a bug -- and I don't think it's one that we've seen before. Thanks for the report; we are adding a layer of move validation in the next week or two that should prevent this, but I'll add it separately just in case.  Thanks again and sorry you had to deal with that.
